description: validation of the Jupyter Notebook cell/output level metadata for ipypublish

___slideonly.description: only output this cell in slides

___caption.description: the caption of the text cell

___format.description: can contain any keywords related to the latex Listings package (such as syntax highlighting colors)

___asfloat.description: whether the text is wrapped in a textcell (float) environment or is inline

___use_ansi.description: if true then, instead of stripping ansi colors in latex output, they will be converted to latex, wrapped in % characters and the listings option escapechar=% set

___widefigure.description: whether to expand the text to the page width (placement arguments will then be ignored)

___label.description: the label of the text cell, e.g. text:example_sym

___placement.description: the placement of the text cell, e.g. 'H'

___alternate.description: using alternating colors for the table rows (see https://tex.stackexchange.com/a/5365/107738)

___label.description: the label of the table, e.g. fig:example_sym

___placement.description: the placement of the table, e.g. 'H'

___widefigure.description: whether to expand the figure to the page width (placement arguments will then be ignored)

___height.description: the height of the figure, as a fraction of the page

___width.description: the width of the figure, as a fraction of the page

___label.description: the label of the figure, e.g. fig:example_sym

___placement.description: the placement of the figure, e.g. 'H'

___caption.description: the caption of the code cell

___format.description: can contain any keywords related to the latex Listings package (such as syntax highlighting colors)

___asfloat.description: whether the code is wrapped in a codecell (float) environment or is inline

___widefigure.description: whether to expand the figure to the page width (placement arguments will then be ignored)

___label.description: the label of the code cell, e.g. code:example_sym

___placement.description: the placement of the code cell, e.g. 'H'

___label.description: the label of the figure, e.g. eqn:example_sym

___environment.description: an environment from amsmath: https://www.sharelatex.com/learn/Aligning_equations_with_amsmath or breqn: https://ctan.org/pkg/breqn

___embed_html.description: embed a html file (html only), use either filepath or url

___other_files.description: files required by the html file (e.g.Â javascript libraries). These files will be copied to the the same folder as the html

___height.description: the height of the embedded object, as a fraction of the viewspace

___width.description: the width of the embedded object, as a fraction of the viewspace
